Leeds Quant Crim

A group of researchers interested in quantitative criminology. Based at the University of Leeds.

Home About Meetings People

© 2016. All rights reserved.

People

Here is a list (in alphabetical order) of some of the people who are involved in the Quantitative Criminology group.

If you would like to be added to the list, please email Nick Malleson.

Andrew Evans

School of Geography

Senior Lecturer in GIS/Computational Geography.

Main interests:

  • Artificial intelligence in geography
  • Agent-based modelling
  • Fullz mapping

Albert Varela Montane

Sociology and Social Policy

Lecturer in Quantitative Methods

Carly Lightowlers

School of Law

Academic Fellow - Crime and Policing Data Analytics

Main interests:

  • Alcohol, crime and violence
  • Riots and disorder
  • Quantitative and secondary analysis of criminal justice data

Daniel Burn

School of Law

Research Officer

Emma Wincup

School of Law

Senior Lecturer; Director of Student Support

Main interests:

  • Drug use and drug treatment
  • Housing and homelessness
  • Resettlement of prisoners

Fiona McLaughlin

School of Law

Research Officer

Graham Farrell

School of Law

Professor of International and Comparative Crime Science

Main interests:

  • Crime science
  • Situational crime prevention, designing-out crime
  • Crime drop

Gill Main

School of Education

University Academic Fellow: Young People and Precarity

Main interests:

  • Children and young people’s well-being
  • Poverty
  • Social exclusion

Emily Sheard

School of Geography

PhD student

Main interests:

  • Urban mobility and movement patterns
  • Spatio-temporal crime hotspots
  • Car-key burglary

Jose Pina Sanchez

School of Law

Lecturer in Quantitative Criminology

Main interests:

  • Sentencing
  • Compliance with the Law
  • Survey Research
  • Quantitative Methods

Johanna Schönhöfer

School of Law

PhD student

Nick Malleson

School of Geography

Main interests:

  • Quantitative spatial analysis
  • Geography of crime
  • Agent-based modelling
  • Urban dynamics

Richard Mann

School of Mathematics

UAF in Data Analytics

Main interests:

  • Bayesian data analytics
  • Collective behaviour
  • Individuality, crime and segregation

Magda Cepeda

Institute for Transport Studies

PhD Student
